intro: Leea guineensis var. cuspidifera, commonly known as the African starwood, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its small, opposite, ovate leaves with acuminate tips, and it produces clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. The plant is often grown as an ornamental due to its attractive foliage and floral display. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. The species is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
